docs.snippet: Cappie Pondexter scored a season-high 21 points to help the Liberty end a three-game losing streak with an 81-64 victory over the visiting Washington Mystics....

headline.main: Pondexter Leads Liberty in Rout of Mystics

docs.snippet: James’s defection from Cleveland can no longer explain why fans continue to assail him, often beyond reason. Is there something deeper in play?...
docs.lead_paragraph: James’s defection from Cleveland can no longer explain why fans continue to assail him, often beyond reason. Is there something deeper in play?
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column asserts that LeBron James continues to prove that he is king of the basketball court, making his many critics grudgingly genuflect with a dominating performance in Game 2 of the NBA finals; notes that James has taken an important step closer to a third straight title with the Miami Heat.

headline.print_headline: James Reigns Supreme, Despite an Unrelenting Siege

docs.abstract: Miami Heat guard Dwyane Wade is fined $5,000 after a review showed that he had exaggerated a foul during Game 2 of the finals that was charged to San Antonio’s Manu Ginobili.

docs.snippet: Phil Jackson, the New York Knicks’ president, and Derek Fisher, their new coach, spoke after Mr. Fisher was hired to replace Mike Woodson....
docs.lead_paragraph: Phil Jackson, the New York Knicks’ president, and Derek Fisher, their new coach, spoke after Mr. Fisher was hired to replace Mike Woodson.

headline.main: Knicks Name Derek Fisher as Coach

docs.snippet: Derek Fisher, a five-time champion as a player with the Los Angeles Lakers and leader of the players union, will take on another challenge: coaching the Knicks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Fisher, a five-time champion as a player with the Los Angeles Lakers and leader of the players union, will take on another challenge: coaching the Knicks.
docs.abstract: Derek Fisher, five-time NBA champion as a player with the Los Angeles Lakers and leader of the players union, will take on new challenge as coach of New York Knicks; choosing Fisher can easily be perceived as a gamble by team president Phil Jackson, who has always been clear about his preference to hire a young coach whom he could mentor; Fisher fits the bill.

headline.seo: Phil Jackson and the Knicks Hire Derek Fisher as Coach

docs.snippet: Rochelle Sterling and her lawyer used a clause in the Clippers trust documents to cut her husband, Donald, out of the deal after doctors found him to be affected by cognitive impairment....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rochelle Sterling and her lawyer used a clause in the Clippers trust documents to cut her husband, Donald, out of the deal after doctors found him to be affected by cognitive impairment.
docs.abstract: Rochelle Sterling and her lawyer are using a clause in the Los Angeles Clippers trust documents to cut her husband Donald out of the deal to sell franchise to Steve Ballmer for $2 billion after doctors found Sterling to be affected by cognitive impairment; closely held legal maneuver capped hectic, weeks-long effort to wrest control of team from Donald Sterling after his racial comments.

headline.seo: Donald Sterling’s Impairment Expedited the Clippers’ Sale to Steve Ballmer
headline.main: Plan B Eased Clippers Deal: Sterling’s Diagnosis
headline.print_headline: Plan B Eased Clippers Deal: Sterling’s Diagnosis

keywords.value: Greenberg Glusker Fields Claman & Machtinger LLP

docs.snippet: The implications of O’Bannon v. N.C.A.A., a class-action lawsuit that could change the economics of college sports....
docs.lead_paragraph: The implications of O’Bannon v. N.C.A.A., a class-action lawsuit that could change the economics of college sports.

headline.main: Will Ed O’Bannon Change the N.C.A.A?

docs.snippet: As the Ed O’Bannon case began on Monday, the N.C.A.A. settled another suit involving the use of college athletes’ likenesses in video games....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the Ed O’Bannon case began on Monday, the N.C.A.A. settled another suit involving the use of college athletes’ likenesses in video games.
docs.abstract: National Collegiate Athletic Assn reaches settlement to pay $20 million to current and former college athletes who sued over the use of their likenesses in video games; players who would most likely receive payments would be men’s basketball and football players who were on rosters of certain teams when the video games were sold; deal comes as higher-profile video game lawsuit, filed by form UCLA basketball star Ed O'Bannon, begins in federal court.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Settles One Video Game Suit for $20 Million as a Second Begins
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Settles One Video Game Suit for $20 Million as a Second Begins

byline.contributor: Ben Strauss reported from Oakland, Calif., and Steve Eder from New York.
byline.original: By BEN STRAUSS and STEVE EDER
